column35:
2022-06-22 06:11;richardt;This is important as [Identifier.type|http://hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html#identifier] is bound [extensibly|https://hl7.org/fhir/terminologies.html#extensible] to [IdentifierType|http://hl7.org/fhir/valueset-identifier-type.html]. This means that any instance of Identifier.type using a coding outside of [IdentifierType|http://hl7.org/fhir/valueset-identifier-type.html] may also need to use a coding inside of [IdentifierType|http://hl7.org/fhir/valueset-identifier-type.html]. For example uses of UPIN must also use the coding PRN, and uses of LACSN must also include ACSN.

The full range of these constraints is not documented anywhere, and should be.

See Zulip [Extensible binding of Identifier.type|https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179177-conformance/topic/Extensible.20binding.20of.20Identifier.2Etype/near/286992151]
column36: 2022-06-22 07:04;tedhl7geek;A decision was taken about 8 years ago when the v2 tables were model-mapped to HL7 Code Systems that all v2 table values are flat, ie NO hierarchy and NO explicit subsumption.    Therefore doing what is requested in this ticket is a violation of that policy.   Any change to the decisions needs to be deliberated by the Vocabulary WG.  [~rhausam]  was there for the decision; this position was proposed and championed by Jim Case at the time.
column37: 2022-06-22 10:42;richardt;That makes the technical problem smaller. Consistent use of [Identifier.type|http://hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html#identifier] does not need a full hierarchy, just a decision as to which members of [identifierType CodeSystem|https://terminology.hl7.org/3.1.0/CodeSystem-v2-0203.html] can be used alone in Identifier.type, and which need to be used together with a value from [IdentifierType ValueSet|http://hl7.org/fhir/valueset-identifier-type.html],
column38:
2022-06-22 10:43;richardt;If it is decided that Identifier.type can have, for example, the coding LACSN without also having the coding ACSN, that needs to be documented clearly in the definition of [Identifier.type|http://hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html#identifier] or [IdentifierType ValueSet|http://hl7.org/fhir/valueset-identifier-type.html].

And guidance needs to be made about how to decide for local codes when one from [IdentifierType ValueSet|http://hl7.org/fhir/valueset-identifier-type.html] is required.
column39: 2022-08-25 10:44;FrankOemig;Agree, we cannot bring this forward without major changes.

column5: Add Tabs for Deprecated Content
column35: 2022-05-27 01:49;tedhl7geek;Upon cursory examination of current content, the only UI display tasks are to add a 'Deprecated' sub-tab to 'HL7 Code Systems' and 'Value Sets'.   Performing the inventory will produce the list of what needs to go into the manifests.  The desired textual paragraphs for the tab pages should be suggested in a comment here, and it will be added when the draft branch and initial content is generated.
column36:
2022-06-23 09:35;jsnell;Below is the text to be added for the deprecation tabs:

HL7 CODE SYSTEMS AND VALUE SETS

Deprecation indicates that the object has been published and is retained for historical purposes, but should not be used to create new content or revise existing content.

For in-depth information about deprecation, including the process to deprecate an artifact (CodeSystem or ValueSet) or element (such as a concept), please see [link to THO documentation , new section]

Deprecation should not be confused with retirement. Deprecation provides usage guidance specifying that the object SHOULD not be used for new or revised content, whereas retirement indicates it SHALL NOT be used for new or revised content.

Deprecation is an HL7-specific process that provides users of HL7 specifications with guidance for using objects within HL7 implementations. For example, an object may be deprecated if it has been in use for some time and then gets updated or replaced, and guidance is to be provided for what to use instead. This may also be done when planning for an artifact (CodeSystem or ValueSet) to be retired in the near future.

ADD SENTENCE BELOW TO RETIRED TABS FOR HL7 CODE SYSTEM AND VALUE SETS

Retirement has been declared by the HL7 steward of the (CodeSystem or ValueSet) and indicates that the formal status of the resource is no longer active.

FOR RETIRED EXTERNAL CODE SYSTEMS

Retirement has been indicated by the HL7 community and/or the owner/publisher of the Code System and indicates that it is no longer active.
column37: 2022-08-29 03:11;tedhl7geek;Put deprecation tabs for HL7 Code Systems, Value Sets, and External Terminologies as described above.   Did NOT put tabs for external identifiers, as that effort is being covered in a related ticket UP-343:   https://jira.hl7.org/browse/UP-343

Group suggests pulling back to draft and increment the version number as a major update (adding a new concept is a major change so it should be 1.0.0). The value set version is likely okay for now, as TSMG is still working on approving a policy for value set versioning. No other issues with the content were found. 

[~corey_spears]
column36:
2022-06-28 02:50;jsnell;Reviewed on UTG/THO subcommittee call on 28 June 2022. It appears these tickets include updates to the same resource. 

Is there any advice regarding the order that these changes be applied, or is any order acceptable? This is a use case that we knew would exist (two tickets updating the same resource), but we are encountering for the first time and want to make sure we get this right. 

Versioning, for example, is a little tricky because each ticket may update the version but when applied sequentially it may not result in the correct number without intervention from the Terminology Curator. Noting that this is something that TSMG will discuss in its Versioning Task Force that is being formed in the near future.

column5: In Table 0203 Explain the difference between SS and SB
column35:
2022-07-29 07:48;RikiM;V2 Management suggest encapsulating Lloyd's answer: Gist is that SB is a generic - it encompasses U.S. Social Security Number, Canadian Social Insurance Number and all sorts of other national (and sometimes regional) identifiers for this purpose.  SS shouldn't really exist as it's not an identifier "type" but actually refers to a specific namespace.  However, it's been used in the US for decades, so we can't exactly make it go away.  In FHIR, if you're sending a US SSN, the Identifier.type is expected to be "SB".

INM is the steward, so need to find a volunteer to update it.

column5: V2 table 0078 missing from HL7 Terminology code systems
column35: 2022-03-08 06:01;tedhl7geek;Table 0078 was removed from the H7 v2 publications some 3-4 years ago; it was merged with and replaced by a single code system published in V3 for many years containing the same concepts.   This can be found at [http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/UTG/CodeSystem-v3-ObservationInterpretation.html].  The Orders and Observations WorkGroup worked diligently to unify these duplicative code systems for several years; Table 0078 as a defined code system will NOT be added to THO; the table content is informed by the v3 code system using the value set at [http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/UTG/ValueSet-v2-0078.html] (the published release of this is at  [https://terminology.hl7.org/3.1.0/ValueSet-v2-0078.html])
column36:
2022-03-08 09:48;rhausam;As Ted said, OO made a significant effort over a period of several years to achieve harmonization on this code system across the HL7 standards families, and the ObservationInterpretation code system in THO as noted above is the result.  The code system page lists these value sets for this:

[http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/valueset-observation-interpretation.html]

[http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/UTG/ValueSet-v2-0078.html]

[http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/UTG/ValueSet-v3-ObservationInterpretation.html]

All three value sets are defined as:
 * Include all codes defined in [{{http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-ObservationInterpretation}}|http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/UTG/CodeSystem-v3-ObservationInterpretation.html]

So you should be able to use the value set that is most appropriate for what you are doing.

column5: Add Identifier Systems from FHIR to THO and Other Identifier System Cleanup
column35:
2022-02-08 07:03;jsnell;[~reuben.daniels], thanks for validating my build changes. A few things to look out for: 
 # The following URI for Passport Numbers from [http://build.fhir.org/identifier-registry.html] is [http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/passport-[XXX]]  and I am not sure if square brackets are allowed. 
 # I removed the unified->namingSystems folder. It was previously a placeholder when we didn't know where to put identifier systems, but I moved it over the HTA folder since we decided identifier systems are under the purview of the HTA. I'm not sure the consequences of deleting a folder. 
 # The GTIN uri was incorrect and looked like it was auto-generated for THO. I removed the old one (instead of setting it as preferred=F because I believe this is an error). If you disagree we can add it back in.
column36:
2022-02-08 04:57;reuben.daniels;Hi [~jsnell]

Thanks for the message. I have the following responses:
 # I assume you meant the URL for Passport Numbers is "http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/passport-[XXX]" – you are correct that the square brackets are not allows. I suspect [XXX] is meant to be a pattern which can be replaced with a three character country code e.g. [http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/passport-USA] for the United States of America. I suggest we confirm with FHIR-Infrastructure and also where the three-letter country codes are sourced from and whether they need to be uppercase, lowercase or a mix. [~lloyd] or [~yunwwang], can you please weigh in?
 # I haven't encountered any issues, but will let you know if I come across anything.
 # This should be fine. We can raise this in Wednesday's TSMG meeting to confirm with the other TSMG/HTA members.
column37: 2022-02-08 07:50;lloyd;3-letter codes are from [http://build.fhir.org/valueset-iso3166-1-3.html,] and they're all upper-case
column38:
2022-02-08 03:57;reuben.daniels;Hi [~lloyd]

Thank you for the reply. Two follow-up points:

1. I have checked the OID for Passport Numbers stated in the FHIR core spec's identifier system registry (2.16.840.1.113883.4.330) and determined that this OID is actually the parent OID of the actual OIDs which should be used for passport numbers. Further, use of the child OIDs is not mentioned in the identifier registry and thus readers may incorrectly assume that the 2.16.840.1.113883.4.330 OID is to be used for all passports. Do you agree that this is an issue and one which must be resolved as part of the transition of this content to THO?

2. Noting that there are about 249 country codes in the expansion of the  [http://build.fhir.org/valueset-iso3166-1-3.html|http://build.fhir.org/valueset-iso3166-1-3.html,] value set, this will lead to an additional 249 THO identifier system NamingSystem resources in THO as THO does not have a means to represent patterned URIs. Accordingly, this will take a significant amount of time and also has UI implications for the HL7 Terminology website layout.

With the above in mind, Jess and I are interested to hear FHIR-I's thoughts on how we best deal with this in the limited time we have (THO content freeze coming up on 20 February 2022). We see the following options:

1. Remove the identifier registry from the FHIR core spec (in line with  FHIR-35932) and create the 249 THO identifier system NamingSystem resources corresponding to each country passport and apply the correct OID in each.

2. Remove the identifier registry from the FHIR core spec (in line with  FHIR-35932) and postpone creation of the 249 THO identifier system NamingSystem resources (including correction of the OIDs) to the scope of the next release of THO.

Keen you to hear your thoughts or other any other suggestions.

Thank you.
column39:
2022-02-08 04:28;lloyd;Presume the resolution will be to create a NamingSystem for every possible country (Wheee....) and each one will have its appropriate OID.  We don't have machinery right now to manage sub-pages for stuff like passports to describe general rules.  So I don't see a whole lot of choice in the short term.  In the intermediate term, we should think about how we might revamp the UI to allow 'grouping' certain subsets of identifiers like passport numbers and US drivers licenses.

I'm not thrilled about the notion of deferring the creation as it creates a risk of someone trying to invent their own.  If you give me a list of the country codes, country numbers and country names (US English) and a base template of what you'd like one to look like, I can write a transform that'll generate the 249 instances.  (At some point, this'll get out of date when some new country comes into being, but we'll worry about that when someone complains.)
column40:
2022-02-10 02:01;jsnell;[~lloyd], thank you for your assistance with creating the NamingSystems for each instance. I've attached a spreadsheet to this ticket (Passport Number Identifier Systems.xlsx) that includes the elements that will change across instances. All other elements should remain constant. 

There is an example NamingSystem (passportNumNS-AFG.xml). The file name matches id. 

These entries will also need to be added to the ...\input\sourceOfTruth\control-manifests\identifiers-Rendering.xml manifest and also as special-url values in ...\input\utg.xml. Please reach out if you have any questions. 

Will you be able to commit the changes to the branch used in this ticket? 

Thanks again,

Jess

column5: Add unknown to CodeSystem condition-clinical
column35: 2022-03-14 07:33;AMS;Why is it necessary to add unknown to this code system when a code for unknown already exists as a null flavor or missing value reason? Shouldn't the value set be modified to use these values rather than altering the code system?
column36:
2022-03-24 03:56;michelle.m.miller;[~AMS]

+*Patient Care FHIR Conference Call on 2022-03-24*+

Most other FHIR "required" bindings are to FHIR-managed code systems that DO contain an unknown code, such as:  [Codesystem-request-status - FHIR v4.6.0|http://build.fhir.org/codesystem-request-status.html] and [Codesystem-event-status - FHIR v4.6.0|http://build.fhir.org/codesystem-event-status.html]

Because this element is a CodeableConcept with a "required" binding, it is somewhat unique that it goes through UTG review.  PC questions why we wouldn't treat this code system like other required bindings because PC doesn't think it will get reused outside of the context of FHIR Condition.clinicalStatus given how tailored this code system is to that context of use.

The alternative is to curate our value set to pull in unknown from [Codesystem-data-absent-reason - FHIR v4.6.0|http://build.fhir.org/codesystem-data-absent-reason.html], but that creates a variance in pattern from other required bindings (added complexity without obvious benefit)
column37: 2022-03-25 08:03;AMS;[~michelle.m.miller] Thanks for the explanation. I now understand why adding 'Unknown' to the code system is desired. The alternative would be to modify the 'required' binding to bind to a value set instead of the code system. "*added complexity without obvious benefit*"
column38:

2022-06-14 02:37;LisaRNelson;I was previously concerned how this would impact the Clinical Status template in C-CDA.  but i reviewed that template and confirmed that the Clinical Statement pattern for Clinical Status of a Problem will allow the use of the null flavor of "unknown".  

Note: If the guidance wants to prohibit the use of the concept "other" that really needs to be addressed explicitly. Right now there is nothing prohibiting the use of "other".

column5: Change the value set definition of FHIR MeasureType valueset to explicitly not include retired codes.
column35:
2022-02-04 01:01;abdullah.rafiqi;[https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/194616-terminology-.2F.20utg/topic/Setting.20compose.2Einactive.20.3Dfalse.20still.20displays.20code]

 

Zulip thread about inactive code still showing up within valueset
column36:
2022-02-22 03:30;carmela_couderc;Will a new version of the current value set be created, or a new value set since the content logical definition is changing? The value set version is 0.2.0 in both the current release of THO 3.0.0, and the build version 3.0.5.   This doesn't seem right.  [~Rob_McClure] - interested in your thoughts

Also - the rendering of the CLD in THO does not include the information that includeRetired = False - which isn't specific to this ticket, but something for another day.
column37:
2022-02-22 07:43;Rob_McClure;[~abdullah.rafiqi] Carmela is correct, you should not keep the version of the value set the same. I suggest you make this version 0.3.0 but versioning in terminology systems is a disaster and the versions are overwritten by the publishing system. Yet, it cannot be the same as the current published version.

[~carmela_couderc] Agree rendering is not correct. Unfortunately I don't know how we submit issues against the publisher. It needs one that says " ValueSet.compose.inactive is not rendered in the HTML and needs to be to correctly describe the compose."
column38: 2022-02-23 05:39;rhausam;[~abdullah.rafiqi] Could you provide an explanation of the rationale for why the retired codes should be excluded from the expansion in this case?  For some use cases, it is desirable to include retired codes, so it would be good to understand the situation here.  Also, I note that in the current published version of the value set in THO, ValueSet.*immutable* is set to '*true*'.  That means that no new versions of this value set definition can be created.  With that, in order to have what you want you will need to create a new value set - which must have a different 'id' and 'url'. :(
column39:
2022-02-23 08:51;Rob_McClure;[~rhausam] 
 # The intent of this value set was to include all *ACTIVE* measure type codes and since the code system was designed to only contain measure type concepts, the CLD was "all the codes in the code system." The assumption was no problematic changes would ever occur, which we now know should *never* be assumed and we found a code in this code system that was not proper, and needed to be changed to a different code system.
 # While theoretically useful, "Immutable" is actually in practice not very useful, even in situations such as this where all codes in the code system is appropriate only when no errors in the code system _will ever occur_. It should not have been used here. The restriction is only problematic and is not implementably useful in any way.
 # This valueset is used in many eCQMs and cannot have the ID changed.
 # The prior UTG proposal did the correct thing and retired the incorrect code from the code system used by this value set. It *must not appear in the expansion.*
 # The assumption has been among many of us that the default behavior of terminology servers was *to not include inactive codes in expansions unless explicitly included*. The FHIR publisher breaks this assumption - improperly in IMO - and includes the inactive code in the expansion. Therefore this proposal adds the assumed behavior as an explicit "inactive=False" that was always assumed to be in the compose. 
 # Therefore this is not a true change in the meaning of the value set compose, it just makes the assumed behavior explicit. So while the immutable is there, this should not be considered a real change in the compose.
column40: 2022-02-23 10:36;carmela_couderc;Hi [~Rob_McClure]  The plan is to keep immutable = true?
column41:
2022-02-23 01:05;mitrep9g;I don't think this value set is used much if at all.

This value set has the OID 2.16.840.1.113883.4.642.3.769, which is not in VSAC

It is not specified in QRDA I or III, nor in HQMF.

That OID is not in any of the HQMF for the May 2021 annual update eCQMs.
column42: 2022-03-11 02:14;abdullah.rafiqi;Per our discussion during the CQI WG call ([https://confluence.hl7.org/display/CQIWC/2022-03-04+Meeting+Agenda),] the HL7 FHIR MeasureType Valueset will remain as is and the UTG change proposal to not include retired codes and only include active codes in expansion via ValueSet.compose.inactive=F will be abandoned.
column43: 2022-03-11 02:16;abdullah.rafiqi;Per our discussion during the CQI WG call ([https://confluence.hl7.org/display/CQIWC/2022-03-04+Meeting+Agenda),] the HL7 FHIR MeasureType Valueset will remain as is and the UTG change proposal to not include retired codes and only include active codes in expansion via ValueSet.compose.inactive=F will be abandoned.

column43:
2022-02-02 05:18;tedhl7geek;Designatiuon.use is datatype coding, thus the way you have it encoded in the resource:

 
<designation>
<use value="900000000000013009"/>
<value value="ASKD"/>
</designation>
 
is not correct.    I am not sure, but I think you need both of the sub elements for coding in there:
 
|*CodeSystem.concept.designation.use*|
|Element Id|CodeSystem.concept.designation.use|
|Definition|A code that details how this designation would be used.|
|[Cardinality|http://hl7.org/fhir/conformance-rules.html#cardinality]|0..1|
|[Terminology Binding|http://hl7.org/fhir/terminologies.html]|[Designation Use|http://hl7.org/fhir/valueset-designation-use.html] ([Extensible|http://hl7.org/fhir/terminologies.html#extensible])|
|[Type|http://hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html]|[Coding|http://hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html#Coding]|
|Comments|If no use is provided, the designation can be assumed to be suitable for general display to a human user.|

 

see [http://hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html#Coding]
column44: 2022-02-04 10:23;j_harper;Canadian implementers have chosen to go in a different direction

column5: To make the Discharge Disposition URI resolvable
column35:
2022-01-25 10:27;tedhl7geek;Thank you for finding this,.   It turns out that the error is in the links in v2tables code system; in v2.9, there is no HL7 table with any values fort this field, they were removed due to IP restrictions on the UB field codes brought by FM WG.   Thus this is a concept domain only. The table description reads:  "Table of codes which specify the disposition of the patient at time of discharge (i.e., discharged to home, expired, etc.). No suggested values. In the US, this field should use the Official Uniform Billing (UB) 04 2008 numeric codes found on form locator 17."    This the error is that these bad links just need to be removed from the row in v2tables for table 0112.   From the v2 version 2.9 ANSI release chapter 2c, the information is:
h3. 0112 - Discharge Disposition

Concept Domain Information
|Concept Domain Name|DischargeDisposition|
|Description|The domain of possible values for the disposition of the patient at time of discharge (i.e., discharged to home, expired, etc.).  No suggested values.  In the US, this field should use the Official Uniform Billing (UB) 04 2008 numeric codes found on form locator 17.|
|Concept Domain Only|yes|

 

Table Metadata
|Table|0112|
|Description|Table of codes which specify the disposition of the patient at time of discharge (i.e., discharged to home, expired, etc.).  No suggested values.  In the US, this field should use the Official Uniform Billing (UB) 04 2008 numeric codes found on form locator 17.|
|Type|User|
|Steward|PA|
|where used|PV1-36|
|HL7 Version Introduced|2.1|

column5: Deprecate the TribalEntityUS Code System in THO
column35: 2022-03-14 07:36;AMS;Is there a recommended acknowledged source of truth code system to be used as an alternative?
column36: 2022-03-17 02:32;minigrrl;In eCR (http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/case-reporting/StructureDefinition-us-ph-tribal-affiliation-extension.html) we bind to the VALUE SET http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-TribalEntityUS which is based on the above code system. What happens to the value set we have used if the code system is deprecated. Is there another code system to use?
column37: 2022-04-22 09:32;Rob_McClure;We do need someone with expert knowledge of how the US wants to represent Tribal entities. I presumed that the "proper" code system for this was the [CDC Race and Ethnicity code system|https://phinvads.cdc.gov/vads/ViewCodeSystem.action?id=2.16.840.1.113883.6.238] (the race part.) But the codes in this older V3 tribal entity code system ([https://terminology.hl7.org/3.1.0/CodeSystem-v3-TribalEntityUS.html)] are completely different - both codes and representational focus (the V3 has many "village of xxx") - so we need input from a representative of the US tribal community to weigh in. [~Matt_Elrod], I think that is on you.
column38: 2022-04-24 09:40;Rob_McClure;And this may be a good source for the FedReg lists of "Federally recognized tribal entities" per year: [https://narf.org/nill/triballaw/directories.html] and from brief search, the list in the federal register hits some, but not all within the Race concepts in CDCREC (Dry Creek Rancheria Band of Pomo Indians, California [previously listed as Dry Creek Rancheria of Pomo Indians of California] is not in the CDC list and I'm sure there are others.) So don't know what the best source for this is.
column39:
2022-05-02 01:26;minigrrl;From [~lconn]: From discussions at CDC on USCDI we have been given information about using the most recent version (2022) of the https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2022/01/28/2022-01789/indian-entities-recognized-by-and-eligible-to-receive-services-from-the-united-states-bureau-of (Indian Entities Recognized by and Eligible To Receive Services From the United States Bureau of Indian Affairs).

"The following standards for the answer: Indian Entities Recognized by and Eligible To Receive Services From the United States Bureau of Indian Affairs, 87 FR 4636, 01/28/2022 (https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2022/01/28/2022-01789/indian-entities-recognized-by-and-eligible-to-receive-services-from-the-united-states-bureau-of) with added HL7 NullFlavor values: NI (no information), OTH (other), UNK (unknown), ASKU (asked but unknown). "
column40: 2022-05-02 03:45;Rob_McClure;[~minigrrl] You have confirmed the [FR source| https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2022/01/28/2022-01789/indian-entities-recognized-by-and-eligible-to-receive-services-from-the-united-states-bureau-of] for the strings, which is the same as most recent link at the nerf.org location. But we need a code system that has those strings as concepts. Where do we get that code system? Will it be in the updated CDC Race and Ethnicity code system?
column41: 2022-08-23 01:27;marc.duteau;Due to complications with the source for this code system this ticket is returning to the proposal draft state until we know what should actually happen with this code system.

column5: Deprecate the Race Code System in THO
column35: 2022-01-05 04:10;marc.duteau;https://bitbucket.hl7.org/projects/UTG/repos/utg/commits/6180b4ab38a28d8a30c75de92413555c2da411e6
column36:
2022-01-06 06:27;Rob_McClure;Code system [http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-Race]

I have a number of issues with this as it stands:
 * This proposal list the OID for the code system as 2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.14914, but the page in the build has the OID = 2.16.840.1.113883.5.104, Which is correct?
 * There are MANY value sets that reference the race code system and when the code system is retired, we need to likely retire all the value sets that reference it, or change them all to reference one of the two active race and ethnicity code systems. It is not clear to me that any of these sub-part value sets are used at all. 

[~marc.duteau] and [~Matt_Elrod] - can you clean this up?
column38: 2022-01-10 08:33;marc.duteau;The control manifests have been updated to show the file is in the retired list and the ticket is back in consensus review.
column39: 2022-01-10 11:51;Rob_McClure;[~marc.duteau] - Sorry, but have you addressed the issues Ted and I identified? Or will [~Matt_Elrod]? As this stands I will vote NEG.
column40:
2022-01-10 02:30;marc.duteau;This part of Ted's comment has been addressed:

"{{I do see that the v3 code system (an artifact pushlished im the v3 coremif for decades) does have its status set to 'retired', but the change to the manifests to remove it from the active v3 code systems list to the retired code systems list was not done.}}"

But I don't have the ability to fix and/or address the other issues. [~Matt_Elrod] will have to change the OID in the proposal description as well as the link in the change object field to the code system OID and link, as well as the sponsor stuff. I believe there are separate Jira tickets for tackling the value sets though either [~LisaRNelson] or [~Matt_Elrod] could speak to that.
column41:
2022-01-21 07:56;RikiM;Coming into the discussion late - so apologies, if this is clear to everyone else.

the codes used in this code system look like the CDCREC codes - I believe that is what happened in V2 - HL7 adopted them for use with the applicable table number. Shoudn't this code system entry point to the CDCREC code system and indicate it should be used instead?

Another question: CDCREC covers both race and ethnicity values - but this is not addressing the ethnicity code system ([https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/UTG/branches/UP-263-deprecate-the-race-code-system-in-tho/CodeSystem-v3-Ethnicity.html),] which is a subset of the CDCREC codes. 

Should THO provide valuesets for use for race and ethincity drawing from CDCREC, providing the appropriate codes for each - that can then be used across ALL HL7 product families?
column42:
2022-01-21 10:20;tedhl7geek;The HL7 v2 come system has bee retired.    Right now there is no browsable link to CDCrec to point to; there is active work underway to address that.

 

The original HL7 Ethnicity code system was a two concept system with the code H and N.  These do not exist in CDCREC - the concepts do, but different codes.   This should probably be straightened out some day.
column43: 2022-01-21 10:29;tedhl7geek;Note also that the changes in this proposal do not seem to address the issue of the many V3 value sets built on this code system which is being retired.   TSMG should be asked what is the governance directive when this is done to underlying code systems?   Have they made any decisions on this kind of thing [~reuben.daniels] and [~cmacumber]?
column44: 2022-02-02 01:37;AMS;Prior to depreciation, if approved, there should be an indication of what code system is to be used in its stead. The example shows the code system as retired not deprecated; was this intentional or an error? This code system is used in a large number of existing specifications; has any consideration been given to a migration path for them?
column45: 2022-02-02 02:09;tedhl7geek;AMS, the vocab WG has not yet approved the means to deprecate a code system and show it in the THO UI.  Your points are valid and important.    This should likely not be retired if it is just deprecated.    The Deprecation task force has made some recommendations for codes, but I do not recall if they have finished their work for Code Systems.  It may require an extension to be defined for this.
column46: 2022-03-14 07:36;AMS;Is there a recommended acknowledged source of truth code system to be used as an alternative?
column47: 2022-03-16 12:31;Rob_McClure;[~AMS] CDC is the source for race and ethnicity in USA and always has been but like many things we've both made things difficult. CDC has *_one_* code system for both race and ethnicity. It is the code system [Race & Ethnicity - CDC|https://phinvads.cdc.gov/vads/ViewCodeSystem.action?id=2.16.840.1.113883.6.238] is actually _officially_ found as an excel file [here|https://phinvads.cdc.gov/vads/DownloadHotTopicDetailFile.action?filename=29DF7191-76CC-E611-8E51-0017A477041A]     This request is because HL7 split that single code system, that has two root codes, Race and also Ethnicity, into two code systems. It is not two code systems, it is one, with a single url and a single OID.
column48:
2022-05-31 02:23;jsnell;UTG/THO subcommittee reviewed this ticket on 5/31/22. 

[~marc.duteau] to follow up with [~Matt_Elrod] to use the deprecation process outlined by the Vocab Deprecation Task Force.
column49:
2022-08-22 09:02;jsnell;[~Matt_Elrod] , [~marc.duteau] will work with you to follow the deprecation process outlined on  [https://confluence.hl7.org/display/VOC/Deprecation+Policy+Framework] . [~tedhl7geek] will assist with the creation of the appropriate tabs, since we will be adding tabs for deprecated content in THO. 

Noting that there are two other tickets related to deprecating code systems:

https://jira.hl7.org/browse/UP-264

https://jira.hl7.org/browse/UP-265

column36: 2022-01-18 03:14;mitrep9g;We want changes to both the code system and the value set.
column37:
2022-01-20 09:33;jrubini;* Measure type value set UP-257 - Discussion with Vocabulary WG Q3 and OO WG Q4 on Tuesday, January 19: 
Concern about the definitions which are not entirely clear.  Discussion about potential update to definitions:

Consider defining patient experience similar to the Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ):

Patient experience encompasses the range of interactions that patients have with the health care system, including their care from health plans, and from doctors, nurses, and staff in hospitals, physician practices, and other health care facilities. As an integral component of health care quality, patient experience includes several aspects of health care delivery that patients value highly when they seek and receive care, such as getting timely appointments, easy access to information, and good communication with health care providers.

 *  

[https://www.ahrq.gov/cahps/about-cahps/patient-experience/index.html]

 * Consider defining patient engagement as:

"Patient engagement" is a broader concept that combines patient activation with interventions designed to increase activation and promote positive patient behavior, such as obtaining preventive care or exercising regularly. [https://www.healthaffairs.org/do/10.1377/hpb20130214.898775/full/]

Consider that Experience might be a parent to Patient Experience based on the definition of Experience; Patient Engagement would also be a child.

To place back in Zulip chat.

Once the requesting community settles on a potential change, bring it back to OO to update the UTG proposal and then re-vote on the potential solution.

The ticket should be updated to assure it references a change to the code system and to the code.

CQI will be the sponsoring WG, OO voted to be the co-sponsoring WG since OO owns the Observation-value code system. (see OO notes for vote)
column38: 2022-04-01 07:51;abdullah.rafiqi;Due to continued internal discussions regarding MeasureType codesystems and their definitions, we will be withdrawing/abandoning this UTG Change proposal.
column39: 2022-04-01 07:53;abdullah.rafiqi;Due to continued internal discussions regarding MeasureType codesystems and their definitions, we will be withdrawing/abandoning this UTG Change proposal.

column37:
2022-06-14 02:57;LisaRNelson;I'm taking issue with the proposed definition for this code and/or the proposed code.  The issue is that Advance Care Directives do not necessarily imply that "actions can be taken".  Some advance care directives simply state preferences that should be taken into consideration when someone with the needed authority to make a decision actually decides what to do or not to do.  

I am recommending a different code and/or a different definition be considered to avoid confusion.  

[~corey_spears] [~mariadmoen] [~Matt_Elrod] @stephen chu [~emmanurse] [~lheermann]

UTG/THO subcommittee reviewed the ticket on 6/14/22. 

If you do not have voter permissions (do not have options at the top of the screen to vote Affirmative or Negative), you can request them via the Consensus Review area on this page: https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=91993407#VocabularyMaintenanceatHL7-ConsensusReview
on 6/14/22.

column5: Update TestScript testscript-operation-codes to replace 'history' with scope specific values
column35:
2021-10-28 02:35;richard.ettema;List of proposed replacement codes, their display values and descriptions:

||Code||Display||Description||
|history-instance|History Instance|Retrieve the change history for a particular resource instance|
|history-type|History Type|Retrieve the change history for a particular resource type|
|history-system|History System|Retrieve the change history for all resource types|
column36: 2021-11-01 12:00;lloyd;I don't think this code system should exist at all.  There's already a standard internal FHIR code system for the base operations.  We should come up with a convention of using the operation URLs as the codes for the operations rather than needing to define codes every time we create new ones.  So I'm not in favor of this change.  Also, this set of codes is not obviously something that should be maintained as part of UTG.
column37:
2021-11-01 03:12;richard.ettema;[~lloyd],

I agree that this code system should not be maintained as part of UTG.  This code system apparently got moved from the FHIR spec between 4.5.0 and 4.6.0 - not sure why.

I also agree that using the existing standard internal FHIR code systems for the base operations is a better idea.  However, I do believe we still need this code system to define additional operations needed for the TestScript resource.

Please refer back to FHIR-33867 for more details.
column38: 2021-11-16 07:25;Rob_McClure;[~AMS] you need to provide a reason for your negative vote please.
column39: 2021-11-17 06:47;richard.ettema;[~Rob_McClure]- both Lloyd and I agree that this code system should not be maintained by UTG. The resolution of the FHIR-33867 issue has changed such that this code system is no longer used. I would like to withdraw this issue as it is no longer applicable. To do so should I simply use the "Abandon" selection above?

column44:
2021-10-29 12:38;FrankOemig;Agreed, this is a known issue for many years. In the nineties we have done some tweaking to have better "tables". This was further improved with the tables project. 

Taking the move to v2+ it is the intent, at least my one and perhaps of others as well, to replace "tables" by "concept/vocabulary domains", "value sets" and "codesystems".

Anyhow, this problem introduces the notion to create new codes for a codesystem by applying special rules to another codesystem.  In this case, the code should be "NN"+<ISO-3166-3-char-code> resulting in "NNDEU" for Germany.

A clean solution would be to allow for creating codesystem contents by defining rules based on other codesystems! Another option would be to replace "NNxxx" by the set we can generate right now and add codes if necessary. Or we can place an expansion rule in the value set instead of this code, so not to add it to the codesystem, but the value set by inclusion.

However, I support the discussion and an appropriate change proposal.
column45: 2021-10-29 07:53;tedhl7geek;Frank, did you look at the link in Published Example above to see the set of codes that Jens is proposing to be added?
column46:
2021-11-05 07:32;craig.newman;This is related to a similar issue in table 0396 where HL7xxxx, 99zzz and other code systems need to be expanded (sometimes based on a defined list (eg HL7 table) and sometimes not (eg. 99zzz). Table 0335 also needs a "pattern" based solution. There should be a common approach for all of these tables.

For this specific issue, the v2MG supports an expansion of table 0203 to automatically include all possible values based on a rule that prepends all values in the ISO table with "NN" to create the list of valid values here.

The InM WG will be reaching out to set up some time to discuss the more general solution.
column47: 2021-11-11 09:00;tedhl7geek;[~craig.newman] and [~FrankOemig] please review the proposed new code set - I think there may be some issues as the proposed codes are not consistent with our policy of display names and descriptioins of the concept codes for v2.

column52:
2021-12-14 01:34;tedhl7geek;Jens,

The TSMG has not yet decided how long tickets can languish in Consensus Review before they are returned to the Submitter for rework or socialization to get more support for another try.   I have seen a few notifications of pull requests from Bitbucket - and there are comments above noting some things missing or not consistent with V2 vocabulary policy that wold require changes.   For any change - including and edits you make to content in Bitbucket - you must pull the ticket back to Draft, make the changes, and resubmit it.  This begins the voting with updated content, and notifies all of those that voted already that they should reexamine the ticket with the updated content.    I think you need to make some changes, as your proposed content (viewable through the Published Example link above) is not acceptable to a few of the voters above.    You should absolutely have the permissions to cancel the voting cycle and pull the proposal back to Draft for changes; if you do not please let me know right away.
column53: 2021-12-14 01:36;tedhl7geek;In your question to Tony and Riki, all code system concepts  MUST have meaningful display names in addition to the concept codes, and I am pretty sure V2 concepts also require a definition of the concept as well.  Leaving only the code column populated, and/or having the display name not related to the concept but only to part of the concept, I would think is unacceptable.
column54: 2021-12-14 04:57;jkiddo;Ehhm.... all the codes have a meaningful display value so what am I missing here?
column55: 2021-12-14 04:58;jkiddo;- and with Tony you mean Anthony- and with Riki you mean Ulrike?
column56:
2021-12-14 05:14;jkiddo;The NNxxx already states: `National Person Identifier where the xxx is the ISO table 3166 3-character (alphabetic) country code`

-which does in fact describes the concept as a whole. Would you like to have that text duplicated in all 249 concepts? 

-and thinking about it, I don't even think that sentence makes sense. There are many countries that do not have national person identifiers, which actually sort of invalidates the statement in itsef. I'm more and more inclined to suggest that NNxxx should be marked deprecated instead as it is neither directly correct nor a computable value/expresseion.
column57: 2021-12-14 08:43;tedhl7geek;Since the code "NNxxx" will be removed and only that comment must stay in text somewhere (I don't know where, the v2 folks need to suggest something) just having the names of the countries as the display name does not indicate that the code signifies the national identifier for that country.    That to me is the issue.
column58:

or National Identifier for German Persons

or National Identifier for German Citizens

or National Identifier for Persons in Germany

or ...

column62: 2022-01-31 10:23;tedhl7geek;As per the discussion at the January 2022 WGM, the approach to these kinds of V2 tables values should be different.   See the minutes of the discussion at [https://confluence.hl7.org/display/VOC/Jan+2022+-+HL7+WGM+-+Friday+Q1+Minutes].   In addition, the new codes added to the code system in this proposal do not follow good vocabulary practices.    Their display names to not indicate the concept (only part of it) identified by the code value, and there are no descriptions for the concept codes.

column40:
2021-10-13 04:03;tedhl7geek;**Did the build with IGP 1.1.82, and I have a question - *[~marc.duteau]* did you validate with a build?    A new error of an invalid syntax for the <id> element that did not exist in the previous commit just surfaced:
h2. input/sourceOfTruth/v3/valueSets/v3-HL7FormatCodes.xml Show Validation Information (1)
|*Path*|*Severity*|*Message*|
|*ValueSet.where(url = 'http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/hl7-formatcodes')*|*error*|*Conformance resource /Users/tedklein/Documents/tedhl7/vocabulary/Projects/UTG/gitImages/in-flight/UP-241/input/sourceOfTruth/v3/valueSets/v3-HL7FormatCodes.xml - the canonical URL (http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-HL7FormatCodes) does not match the URL (http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/hl7-formatcodes)*|
|*ValueSet.url*|*error*|*Resource id/url mismatch: v3-HL7FormatCodes/http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/hl7-formatcodes*|
|*ValueSet*|*warning*|*vsd-0: 'Name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation' Rule 'Name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation' Failed*|
|*ValueSet.compose[0].include[2].concept[0]*|*warning*|*The code 1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.88.59 is not valid in the system http://dicom.nema.org/resources/ontology/DCM*|
|*ValueSet.where(id = 'v3-HL7FormatCodes')*|*warning*|*Error from server: Unable to provide support for code system http://ihe.net/fhir/ihe.formatcode.fhir/CodeSystem/formatcode*|
|*input/sourceOfTruth/v3/valueSets/v3-HL7FormatCodes*|*error*|*URL Mismatch http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-HL7FormatCodes vs http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/hl7-formatcodes*|

One of the peculiar FHIR rules is that for anything that is not external (outside of HL7), the suffix of the <url> value must match the <id>.   It appeared that you violated this rule.

They syntax restriction on the characters that can be in the <id> is documented here: [https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=91995515#SpecifyingtheDetailsInsidetheProposal-CodeSystemMetadata]

column5: CLONE - Create Present On Admission Indicators Value Set
column35:
2021-07-29 06:53;mitrep9g;I see https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/UTG/branches/UP-219-clone-create-present-on-admission-indicators-value-set/ValueSet-POAIndicators.html
with defining URL http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/POAIndicators

If that defining URL is stable, perhaps we can use that in the QI-Core update (to be circulated for WG review soon and non-ballot update)?
column36: 2021-07-29 07:10;rhausam;What exactly is the rationale for not following the practice that has been defined in the code system of using the code '1' to make an explicit declaration of "Unreported/Not used", and instead exclude that code from the value set and omit the element in those cases?
column37:
2021-07-29 07:38;mitrep9g;See https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=116465844
Also, we wanted a required binding in http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-qi-core/StructureDefinition-qicore-encounter-diagnosisPresentOnAdmission.html (but not to an "example" value set and code system.)

We also plan to relax the cardinality of http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-qi-core/StructureDefinition-qicore-encounter-definitions.html#Encounter.diagnosis.extension:diagnosisPresentOnAdmission to 0..1; making it mandatory (1..1) would have forced ambulatory providers to modify their system (and we would need the "1" because "admission" is not applicable to them.)  Since it will be optional (change pending) we are not forcing ambulatory providers to add that.  Rather than use "1", they simply omit the extension.
column38: 2021-08-05 03:14;rhausam;Thanks, Paul.  Unfortunately, when I read through this further explanation (which I've done a few times now) I think it probably makes it maybe even somewhat less clear than it was before - or at least it doesn't seem (to me) to really answer my question.  I still would like to know why it would be preferred to make the element optional and exclude the '1' code from the value set, rather than just using the '1' code as it's provided and made explicit in the code system.
column39:
2021-08-05 04:07;mitrep9g;Providers (ambulatory, outpatient) do not have a concept for admission, and their systems do not have anything to assign a "1" code or to populate a POA extension in any way. So, if we kept cardinality 1.. and included "1" in the valueset (since that would be the only code that makes sense for them), we would be forcing them to make changes to their systems for no good reason.

We changed cardinality to 0.. so we do not force these providers to change their systems; they simply do not add the POA extension.

As I understand it, "1" is to be used only on paper forms, so we do not want to allow it in the valueset.

For hospitals or places that do have the concept of admission, we would want them to populate the POA extension, and we do not want them to use "1"; one of the other codes in that code system should apply.  So we exclude "1" from the value set.  

We will probably need to figure out a way to express that the POA extension is mandatory for hospitals and places that have admission, but that will be another issue.  Today for QRDA, there is the HL7 spec, but then CMS publishes its own IG which adds some additional constraints.  We have not gotten to the point where we need a CMS IG on top of a FHIR IG.  For example, a CMS FHIR IG for the IQR program could reference/build on QI-Core and make the cardinality for the POA extension 1...  Maybe there is an invariant that could be added to the HL7 QI-Core IG to express in which cases the POA extension is mandatory, but that will need more work to figure out, and it should not influence this UTG issue.
column40: 2021-08-27 02:09;rhausam;I still don't find this explanation and rationale entirely convincing as to why this is the best approach to take.  But any remaining questions/issues that I still have aren't a showstopper for me.

column5: Create Present On Admission Indicators Value Set
column35: 2021-06-24 06:24;carmela_couderc;FYI [~mitrep9g] [~feisenberg]  First step to creating Present on Admission Value Set.
column36: 2021-06-24 06:28;carmela_couderc;Create a new Value Set, including all codes from the code system.
column37:
2021-06-24 07:14;feisenberg;To add some context, the current FHIR example value set is used by ExplanationOfBenefits.onAdmission and by Claim.diagnosis.onAdmission, both as CodeableConcept / Example.  
US Core does not include the Claim resource and [US Core update Encounter profile|http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/US-Core/StructureDefinition-us-core-encounter.html] also does NOT include an onAdmission concept as part of Encounter.diagnosis. Therefore, the only current use of the existing value set seems to be Claim and ExplanationOfBenefits.

Note that the value set referenced in FHIR R4B has the same URL as FHIR R5 build. However, the content is different in the two existing resources:

FHIR R4B also uses this value set, however, in R4B it contains 4 codes (y – yes, n – no, u – unknown, w – undetermined) The “1” code indicating not required is missing
In FHIR R4B, the value set is used by two FHIR Resources:
•	Resource: ExplanationOfBenefit.diagnosis.onAdmission (CodeableConcept / Example)
•	Resource: Claim.diagnosis.onAdmission (CodeableConcept / Example)

FHIR R5 Claim.diagnosis.onAdmission uses the current http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/ex-diagnosis-on-admission as a CodeableConcept / Example, containing 3 codes (yes, no, unknown)
The value set is used by two FHIR R5 Resources:
•	Resource: ExplanationOfBenefit.diagnosis.onAdmission (CodeableConcept / Example)
•	Resource: Claim.diagnosis.onAdmission (CodeableConcept / Example)

In both versions of FHIR, the value set is only used as an Example.
column38: 2021-06-24 12:19;mitrep9g;Also note [https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/carin-bb/ValueSet-AHANUBCPresentOnAdmission.html]

column40: 2021-06-24 03:30;mitrep9g;To clarify the statement above "this value set will *replace* [http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/valueset-ex-diagnosis-on-admission.html,] ":  when UP-213 is implemented,  [http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/valueset-ex-diagnosis-on-admission.html will|http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/valueset-ex-diagnosis-on-admission.html] will still exist as is; it will NOT *replace* that value set. If [http://hl7.org/fhir/claim-definitions.html#Claim.diagnosis.onAdmission] and [http://hl7.org/fhir/explanationofbenefit-definitions.html#ExplanationOfBenefit.diagnosis.onAdmission] want to continue binding to it, that us up to FM.  QI-Core will bind to the value set created by UP-213, QI-Core will "replace" its binding.  If, for R5, Claim and EOB want to change their binding to the new value set created by UP-213, then someone should submit an appropriate Jira issue.

column5: Create new CodeSystem of "level of assurance"
column35:
2021-04-29 05:16;john_moehrke;I agree adding a code to the HL7 managed codesystem is appropriate. (Adding a code to a codesystem managed by NIST would not be appropriate for us to do). But this is clearly a need driven code, and the current LOA codes are in an HL7 managed codesystem.

The LOA codes already exist in HL7 in this valueset [https://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet-v3-SecurityTrustObservationValue.html]
Thus your codesystem would be [http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-ObservationValue]

so, just define a new code be added to the existing CodeSystem
column36:
2021-04-29 07:13;masnick;Hi [~john_moehrke],

Can you please indicate which code in [http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-ObservationValue] is equivalent to our {{IAL1}} code?

From what I can tell, codes like {{LOAAS1}} may be [authenticator assurance levels|https://pages.nist.gov/800-63-3/sp800-63b.html#sec4] rather than [identity assurance levels|https://pages.nist.gov/800-63-3/sp800-63a.html#sec4], though I'm not experienced with these terminologies so I could be missing something.

For example, this splits IAL and AAL: [https://github.com/TransparentHealth/healthcare-trustmark]

Thanks!
column37: 2021-04-30 11:40;juliemaas;[~masnick], agree re: what you observe about authenticator vs. identity; that is likely due to 800-63-2 (and prior) combining identity assurance with authentication assurance into a level. I'm actually not seeing the 800-63-3 related codes in that table yet at all. It appears we may need to create not just the 1.2 and 1.4 but also 1, 2, and 3. And due to the split of NIST into IAL/AAL in 800-63-3 there would be different codes for identity and authentication assurance. So it seems the levels to add are IAL, IAL1, IAL1.2, IAL 1.4, IAL2, IAL3, and for those who might need them later (?) AAL, AAL1, AAL2, AAL3.
column38:
2021-05-01 09:37;masnick;[~juliemaas], thank you!

Can this be done in a separate code system like {{http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/loa}}? Using the {{v3-ObservationValue}} code system is not ideal for our use case as it may be confusing for implementers considering how many other unrelated codes are part of that.
column39: 2021-05-01 11:41;juliemaas;That seems fine to me but [~lcmaas] has just suggested that what may also make sense is to either add codes to [https://www.hl7.org/fhir/2021May/codesystem-identity-assuranceLevel.html|https://www.hl7.org/fhir/2021May/valueset-identity-assuranceLevel.html] for the newer NIST levels and create an appropriate ValueSet of the new codes for this IG, or create a new, successor version of that CodeSystem specifically for 800-63-3-related codes as we're discussing. If a new CodeSystem is created, it might help if the new CodeSystem name was related to the old CodeSystem name so that it is more obviously a successor. Do you have a conformance liaison who can help guide what the Terminology group might prefer?
column41:
2021-05-04 02:27;masnick;I updated the Proposal Description above to be clearer about what we're asking for based on the discussion here. Below is the *original* version for easy reference:
{quote}We would like to create http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/loa to identify "level of assurance", which are codes representing identity assurance level, based on NIST 800-63-3.

These are the specific codes that should be in this system: http://build.fhir.org/ig/dvci/vaccine-credential-ig/branches/main/CodeSystem-identity-assurance-code-system.html.

There are other LOA codes already a part of UTG: https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/284830-smart.2Fhealth-cards/topic/Bundle.20Format/near/236489633

But as Josh Mande said on Zulip (https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/284830-smart.2Fhealth-cards/topic/Bundle.20Format/near/236497486):

> Based on our discussion in #Security and Privacy (https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/284830-smart.2Fhealth-cards/topic/Bundle.20Format/near/236497486) we needed to craft specific new "intermediate" LOA codes to capture the fact that most real-world id verifications don't reach IAL2.


Our short-term need is to identify the canonical URI for this new code system, and verify that [these specific codes will be in the system (http://vci.org/ig/vaccination-and-testing/CodeSystem-identity-assurance-code-system.html). This is to support the SMART Health Cards: Vaccination & Testing Implementation Guide (http://vci.org/ig/vaccination-and-testing/), which is currently being actively used by implementers.
{quote}
column42:
2021-05-04 03:01;masnick;Based on the discussion above, on Zulip, and on GitHub, I believe everyone is agreed on adding the following codes and descriptions:
|IAL1|Name and birth date were self-asserted.|
|IAL1.2|An unspecified ID was used to verify name and birth date.|
|IAL1.4|A US state-issued photo ID or nationally-issued photo ID was used to verify name and birth date.|
|IAL2|Either remote or in-person identity proofing is required. IAL2 requires identifying attributes to have been verified in person or remotely using, at a minimum, the procedures given in NIST Special Publication 800-63A.|
|IAL3|In-person identity proofing is required. Identifying attributes must be verified by an authorized CSP representative through examination of physical documentation as described in NIST Special Publication 800-63A.|

In terms of which code system they belong in, there appear to be two viable options mentioned above:
 # Create a new code system called {{[http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/loa]}}
 # Use {{[http://hl7.org/fhir/identity-assuranceLevel]}}

My only concern with using #2 is with the code system name in the URI: this mixes [kebab-case|https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/kebab_case] with [camelCase|https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/CamelCase#English], which will look like a typo to the software engineers who are implementing the IG. It also means that implementers will have to remember whether it's {{identity-assuranceLevel}}, {{identityAssurance-level}}, {{identity-assurance-Level}}, etc., which can lead to bugs. A cleaner name in the URI would be {{identity-assurance-level}} or {{identityAssuranceLevel}}.

The code system URI will appear without context in the JSON representation of our FHIR resources inside SMART Health Cards, and will likely be viewed by implementers (or patients!) without prior FHIR experience. So it's important to us from an implementer-friendliness perspective to have a URI that doesn't add friction or raise concerns.

If it's preferable to use {{[http://hl7.org/fhir/identity-assuranceLevel]}} rather than creating a new code system, is it possible to resolve the inconsistency in the name of the code system? (If not, it may be better to deprecate this code system in favor of one without the naming inconsistency, if that's possible.)

Thank you all!!
column43:
2021-05-04 02:59;masnick;To my point above about implementer/patient-friendliness to meet the needs of our use case, we discussed using [http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-ObservationValue] for the code system above.

On further thought, this is not a good fit for our IG because 
{{{"code": "IAL1", "system": "}}{{[http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-ObservationValue]}}{{"}}} will not be understandable to anyone looking at the JSON. From a data modeling perspective, we would like the code system URI to clearly identify the content of the code.

From an implementer/patient-friendliness perspective, this URI does not promote understanding of the data and could even be alarming since the code system name implies “IAL1” is an “observation”.

We are expecting a number of implementers who do not have prior FHIR experience to be working directly with the JSON resources described by this IG. It is better for them if the meaning of {{system}} is clear from the URI since software engineers typically expect names to be meaningful, especially in URIs.

We are also expecting that some patients will decode the contents of their SMART Health Cards themselves, and would like the value of {{system}} to not cause undue concern given the high level of scrutiny projects like SMART Health Cards receive.

For these reasons, v3-ObservationValue doesn't support our primary use case. We would like to proceed with one of the other options described in my previous post.
column44: 2021-05-04 03:03;masnick;One more clarification: our initial suggestion of {{http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/loa}} is not optimal from a clarity perspective since "loa" could be anything. A more descriptive URI would probably be better – but keeping in mind we do have payload constraints so we would prefer to not be overly verbose :)
column45: 2021-06-23 07:22;juliemaas;Checking back in on this...did the conversation continue elsewhere or are you still awaiting further input?

column5: Add ODH Code System content
column35:
2021-04-22 07:25;reuben.daniels;Providing the full content (concepts with identifiers/codes, descriptions, properties, etc.) of a Code System in a FHIR CodeSystem resource published in HL7 Terminology requires a formal agreement between HL7 International and the owner of the code system's intellectual property to support the publication of its content by HL7. The AMA's SNODENT is one of the few examples of this in HL7 Terminology.

Further, it should be noted that by their nature code systems are always changing and publishing them in full comes with the responsibility to ensure they are maintained and up to date – formal agreements will stipulate this. Accordingly, while it may be straightforward to create a FHIR CodeSystem with all the ODH content, the risks of doing so.
(a) without a formal agreement; and 
(b) as a "one-off" which is not maintained on an ongoing basis
Should be understand and carefully considered.

The recommendation and I other members of the HL7 Terminology Authority (HTA) have to progress this is: That HL7 HQ work with Genevieve Luensman from the CDC to obtain a formal agreement (including conditions) to support publication of a complete FHIR CodeSystem for ODH. Once this formal agreement is in place, work can be progressed to develop the CodeSystem resource in accordance with the agreement and published in HL7 Terminology (as was done for SNODENT).

column35:
2021-03-25 10:46;tedhl7geek;Fails syntax and format correctness check:
Duplicate Resource in IG: ValueSet/v2-0937
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.Error: Unable to continue because duplicate input resources were identified

This appears to be due to not updating the <id> value in the new resource from whatever template you copied it from, and you are not permitted to have any resources of the same types (e.g. ValueSet) with he same <id>.    In addition, for those resources rooted in terminology.hl7.org, the <id> value must match the final suffix of the <url> value.

Returning to Draft for correction.
column36: 2021-03-25 01:12;marc.duteau;...Yup. One of these days I'll get one through without missing something like that.
column37:
2021-03-25 04:21;tedhl7geek;Now not a seg fault but a non-fatal hard build error:

ValueSets/v3-LaboratoryObservationSubtype.xml
Path	Severity	Message
/f:ValueSet (l25/c30)	error	Undefined element 'extensible'

I didn't look at your content so don't understand why or where you would have such an element because I only know that term as it pertains to binding, and value sets do not have bindings declared internal to their resources.  Please check your content and fix/resubmit with an explanation of what is going on here.   
Thanks.
column38: 2021-03-25 05:08;marc.duteau;I took a look and it's got "<extensible value="false"/>" I know I didn't add that in manually at all so it looks like the UTG editor adds <extensible value=""/> no matter what and sets it to true if the extensible box is checked and false if it isn't. I removed it manually.

column5: Terminology package for STU3 contains incorrect URIs
Adding code VWDR and clarifying definition of code VW in v3-WorkClassificationODH code system
column35:
2021-03-18 09:57;tedhl7geek;Validation content check build failed.  Error is:
     [java] Unable to find 'internalId' property on code VWDR in code system WorkClassificationODH
     [java] Processing terminated by xsl:message at line 9 in mifQA.xslt

Issue is that all codes that are for systems that end up generated into the coremif need an internalID value - see the other codes for examples.  This must be unique, but the old VMIF processing we used years ago no longer exists so there is not a way to generate this value automatically so it is unique.  A rule of thumb that works is pick one of the other codes, add a zero on the end of the internalID value (multiply by 10) and that almost always works fine.

Returning to Draft for Submitter to apply fix.

column38:
2021-04-01 01:30;mitrep9g;[http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/davinci-deqm/StructureDefinition-gaps-detectedissue-deqm-definitions.html#DetectedIssue.code] refers to [http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/valueset-detectedissue-category.html] which is defined currently as

Include codes from http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-ActCode 
where concept is-a _AdministrationDetectedIssueCode
where concept is-a _ActSuppliedItemDetectedIssueCode
where concept is-a _SupplyDetectedIssueCode

 

This UTG proposal adds CAREGAP under _ClinicalActionDetectedIssueCode, but a separate FHIR Jira issue will be created to add "where concept is-a _ClinicalActionDetectedIssueCode" to that valueset.

Note [https://terminology.hl7.org/2.1.0/CodeSystem-v3-ActCode.html] shows __ClinicalActionDetectedIssueCode with status=retired.  Is that a problem (even though NotSelectable is true)?
column39:
2021-04-01 03:14;yanheras;Hi [~mitrep9g], this proposal has included changing status of __ClinicalActionDetectedIssueCode from retired to active. 

Here is the tracker FHIR-31677 that requests an update to the Detected Issue Category value set
column40:
2021-04-05 02:12;ahenket;After reading the request I'm left clueless as to what a "care gap" is. I would abstain in absence of a definition I understand, having no objection against adding said code. But friendly amendment: could you expand on the definition so I can know what this code means?

Also I accidentally hit "Tabled". Sorry for that. I was looking for abstention as a button and thought I'd find a table of votes behind that button. I did not suspect a status change.
column41: 2021-04-05 02:37;yanheras;Thanks for your review [~ahenket]. Care gap is defined as discrepancies between recommended best practices and the services that are actually provided and documented.
column43:
2021-04-06 12:13;yanheras;Thank you for your review [~rhausam]. The "is" wasn't a typo. This concept is intended to indicate that there are care gaps identified. These care gaps are defined as discrepancies between best practices and the services that are actually provided and documented, for example a patient does not meet the numerator or denominator exclusions criteria of Colorectal Cancer Screen measure so there is a care gap.

[~ahenket] and [~rhausam], we are planning to start the publication process for the Data Exchange for Quality Measure IG ([http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/davinci-deqm/)] very soon. Our only remaining QA errors are generated by needing this new ActCode and also a new valid LOINC code for gaps in care report that we requested for this IG is not recognized by the IG publisher. So this is an immediate blocker for us. If you don't oppose of adding this new concept, would it be okay to approve this proposal first? so it would help us resolving the QA errors to move forward.  I would be more than happy to submit a new proposal to update the concept definition (with your input) right after!
column44: 2021-04-06 01:09;rhausam;That's fair enough.  The definition does need to be revised, but with that I'm happy to vote.
column45: 2021-04-06 02:07;yanheras;Thank you [~rhausam]

column48:

- Identifies the type of detected issue is a care gap

column36:
2021-03-18 03:41;jsnell;Before resubmitting, please update the following:
 # Instead of deleting the concept you wish to remove from the Code System, add a property to the concept to indicate that it has been retired. Apologies for the poor formatting, but I believe it should look similar to below.
 {{<[property|http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/codesystem.html#CodeSystem.concept.property]>}}
      <[code|http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/codesystem.html#CodeSystem.concept.property.code] [value|http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/datatypes.html#code]="status"/>
      <[valueCode|http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/codesystem.html#CodeSystem.concept.property.value[x]] [value|http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/datatypes.html#code]="retired"/>
 </property>
 # Update the date values to indicate that they have been updated
 ## These specific Code Systems also have last updated date fields you will likely want to update as well.
 # Update the version of each Code System. These are major updates per our versioning policy, please increment. [https://confluence.hl7.org/display/VOC/Documented+Execution+of+UTG+Versioning]

[~tedhl7geek] you may want to confirm I haven't missed anything or described the status change incorrectly. (I verified with Ted this is correct)
column37:
2021-03-31 10:59;tedhl7geek;The proposed changes pass all of the syntax and formatting checks (the "auto check" transitions and States) but on manual inspection I see the new added property for 'composite' in the MeasureStype system does not display and is not visualized - although it is defined completely correctly in the source xml resource. This issue is that in order for the code properties to display on the rendered output, the properties used in the CodeSystem must be declared in the header portion of the CodeSystem resource. For a good example of this, look at the v3 system ActCode, which has the definitions of all the properties intended to be shown and supported by the code system; one of the is "status".    If you want this to show up for NeasureType, please declare it in the resource (same style as ActCode, but of course only the one property you are setting to 'retired').

 

Returning to Draft state for correction and resubmittal.

column41: 2021-04-01 08:19;Rob_McClure;I know this is a area that is in flux, but are the version numbers assigned here correct? The version change in both code systems is 0.1.0 to 1.0.0 and I'd like to confirm that is correct. I would agree that this is a major version increment.
column42:
2021-04-01 08:37;jsnell;[~Rob_McClure], I believe they are correct as well. Per our Code System versioning policy (this one is approved by Vocab):

"All changes to concepts by default are an increment of the major number.   Any proposed change could include a proposal to change the minor number instead if the change is asserted to be minor in the change proposal. "
column43:
2021-04-10 03:44;tedhl7geek;[~Rob_McClure], I believe they are correct as well. Per our Code System versioning policy (this one is approved by Vocab):

"All changes to concepts by default are an increment of the major number.   Any proposed change could include a proposal to change the minor number instead if the change is asserted to be minor in the change proposal. "
column44: 2022-01-18 08:43;Rob_McClure;[~abdullah.rafiqi] This has been implemented in the CI build *but* as specified and based upon the expansion process utilized by the publisher, the [MeasureType|http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/valueset-measure-type.html] value set based upon the code system with the now retired "Compost" concept _still contains that retired code_. This is because the expansion includes retired codes. I suspect that is not what you want. This means if you want to only include active codes in the expansion, you need to set ValueSet.compose.inactive = False in the value set definition.
column45:
2022-01-20 07:26;abdullah.rafiqi;[~Rob_McClure], [~tedhl7geek], [~jsnell]

Would making this change require a UTG change proposal ticket?
column46: 2022-01-20 12:43;Rob_McClure;I'd say this is a technical correction so does not need consensus voting, but a change in the git material is needed. [~tedhl7geek] needs to confirm and say how to do this.
column47: 2022-01-31 06:56;Rob_McClure;[~abdullah.rafiqi] I suspect others do not agree with my suggestion that changing the value set definition to explicitly not include retired codes is a technical correction. I think we need a new UTG proposal to set the compose of [MeasureType|http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/valueset-measure-type.html] value set to ValueSet.compose.inactive=F. You will need to do that additional proposal and we'll need to get it approved ASAP so the next publication of THO has what is needed.
column48: 2022-02-01 03:28;tedhl7geek;[~Rob_McClure] since this will produce a change in the expansion that is different than what the voters of this proposal originaly voted on, I don't think it falls into the category of a pro-forma change; however TSMG will have the final say on whether this can be pro-forma or must go in for Consensus Review [~jsnell]

2021-04-09 09:46;tedhl7geek;On inspection, there appears to be one item missing from the Change Request:  this is identified as a proposal for "Unified" vocabulary and is a change to an existing ValueSet.  This ValueSet is currently part of the FHIR collection of Value Sets (on the FHIR subtab for ValueSets in THO).   The Steward of the Value Set is CBCC, but as this requested is coming from the HL7 Affiliate community, it is. of International interest as well.    The wording of the proposal implies this ValueSet is to be promoted from the FHIR suntan to the Unified subtab; if this is correct it must be noted in the proposed changes.  If not, then either the steward of the value set or FMG must weigh in on the change, if not actually endorse it.  From the name of the value set and its content, does not the Security WorkGroup also have some skin in this?

I will check for syntactical errors next.
column38: 2021-04-10 04:22;oliveregger;[~tedhl7geek] we did not intend that the ValueSet is promoted from the FHIR subtab to the Unified subtab, please apologize if we formulated this badly. we would like just that the code will be added to this ValueSet/CodeSystem. The steward of the ValueSet will weight in during this proposal or do I understand the process wrong? It is the first time we want to add a code form the hl7 swiss affiliate so thanks for your patience and feedback.

column45: 2021-09-28 03:06;oliveregger;I just have seen the tab to the right, is my interpretation correct, that I need a OSGVoter Family Requirement (FHIR) and a OSGVoters-Unified vote?
column46:
2021-09-28 03:07;jsnell;[~oliveregger], glad to hear it. If you look at the two tabs on this ticket, 'Voting and Quorum Summary' and 'Quorum Requirement Details', it should provide a little more insight. 

You have 10 out of the 15 require votes. Those in 'OSG' groups (listed on the right side of the ticket) have two votes per proposal so just getting a few more people to weigh in would help move this along. You can certainly tag some of those folks right here on this ticket to let them know you would like input. 

You also need to fulfil the 'unified' family requirement (this is in the 'Quorum Requirement Details' tab). This means that either [~cmacumber] or [~rhausam] need to vote. We reviewed this ticket on today's UTG call so Rob is aware of the ticket, and knowing this is still something you'd like will likely take some time to review and vote on it. 

We are working on making this process easier and more transparent, so hopefully next time the expectations are much clearer :)
column47: 2021-09-28 03:08;jsnell;[~oliveregger] yes, exactly. Also meeting the 15 vote minimum. You are pretty close...
column48: 2021-09-28 03:50;jsnell;[~oliveregger], slight revision. You only need the unified vote (which will close out the family requirement).
column49: 2021-10-04 04:58;oliveregger;[~rhausam] could you have a look at our code proposal which we would like to integrate and possibly vote on it? We need to have the unified family requirement satisfied, if you have any questions on the proposal do not hesitate to contact me.
column50: 2021-10-04 10:58;rhausam;My main question is, does it make sense to add codes like this (similarly with 'at-elga') to this code system and value set in the base FHIR standard?  The code system and value set are defined as "This value set includes *sample* Regulatory consent policy types from the US and other regions." (emphasis mine).  I don't think that this code system and value set were actually intended to contain the policy rule codes for all jurisdictions - just *examples* of them.  It is a bit odd that Consent.policyRule has an extensible binding to this example value set, but that could be taken up with the CBCC WG.  The IG for the Swiss EPR system (presumably there is one?), though, could include this value set and then *also* include this or any other needed codes that could be defined in the IG for that use.  I think that should also be workable?  I may still vote for this, but I would like for us to consider this broader question on it first.
column51: 2021-10-04 08:25;oliveregger;[~rhausam] thank you for your comments. I did not interpret this ValueSet as a "sample" due to the extensible binding on Consent.policyRule. We can put the code in our swiss implementation guide, however since most of the samples are from US origin I think it might be still add value to add a few other codes from other jurisdictions. If there would be further discussion on a call can you let me know?
column52: 2021-10-04 11:07;rhausam;I'm not certain that my interpretation or suggested solution is necessarily correct, [~oliveregger].  But, as I mentioned earlier, from what is written I think it is at least plausible.  This may represent a case where something that originally began as an example then became considerably more than that (whether that should happen is a question, but at least in some cases it has).  I agree that even if we leave this code system/value set as an example, it may be very reasonable to add a few additional codes (likely including yours) from multiple jurisdictions.  Maybe we need to arrange some discussion with CBCC to better understand what their intent (past and present) for this actually is?
column53: 2021-10-05 12:28;oliveregger;Yes, I think a discussion with CBCC about their intent would be helpful. They have a call on Wednesday 01:00 PM (US Eastern Time), however the call tomorrow is cancelled. [~rhausam] Would you be able to attend one of the following calls or would it be better to try to schedule the discussion for the next wgm?
