column5: Clarify use of HL7nnnn in table 0396
column35: 2020-06-01 12:36;tedhl7geek;I hesitate to return this to active status as it is:  1) not a legal code; 2) was NEVER a legal code, it is a convenience construct to avoid having to explicitly list every legal code for the individual tables (600+ of them); 3) as UTG resources are intended for use to load conformance validating server instances, adding such a code with a 'comment' intended for human readers flies just fine in a PDF document, but is IMHO bad practice in a machine-readable resource.
column36: 2020-06-01 01:01;craig.newman;[~tedhl7geek] - what is your suggestion then? Just updating the text or removing the code totally? Given that it's not a PDF anymore, should we list every valid HL7 table?
column37: 2020-06-01 03:30;tedhl7geek;For technical correctness and completeness, I suspect that each current table should have a proper legal entry (with the old ones that have been removed or withdrawn having codes there that are marked 'retired').   This might be considered overkill however, as well as being a fair amount of work to be added (we can do it programmatically, but it will take some hours to put together; it would be based on an xslt against the v2tables.xml file is easiest I would think).   I would like to hear from some of the other V2 folks who work with the v2 content and validation though.    If we do not do that, then the code indeed should be marked as 'retired' and document that it was originally in the table in error (for many years) and should never be used verbatim.   I definitely would like to hear from Conformance, but IMHO conformance checkers SHOULD throw an error if the string "HL7nnnn" (exactly that) is in any message instance.
column38: 2020-06-02 10:06;craig.newman;Initial discussion from the Conformance WG available at [https://confluence.hl7.org/display/CONF/2020-06-01+Conformance+Call]. The discussion will continue on the 6/9 call.
column39:
2020-06-17 06:28;craig.newman;Further notes from Conformance (with Ted) are available at [https://confluence.hl7.org/display/CONF/2020-06-09+Conformance+Call]

Two motions were passed:

Motion for Conformance policy: The v2 table content relative to the modern update process of UTG that the table of content is defined by the associated value set, if there is no associated value set then table of content is informed by a subset of the associated code system, if there is no associated value or associated code system then are no suggested values. *Ted/Ioana 4-0-1*

Motion on approach to HL7 396: Work item for conformance, we should create an expanded list of the equivalent concepts for table HL7 396 and add a JIRA tracker item in HL7 v2 for this issue. *Rob/Frank 5-0-0*
column40: 2021-10-12 02:42;tedhl7geek;on the 10/12/21 UTG call, we all decided that these are really waiting for input as this is coordination with the V2 management group to determine what to do about this, and with TSMG to decide what our governance and publishing of content should look like for items that for decades had syntactic shorthand for hundreds of codes that were decided to not be printed in the paper/pdf documents of vocabulary publishing of old.   This decision needs revisiting.
column41: 2021-10-25 06:12;craig.newman;[~tedhl7geek] What feedback are you looking for from v2MG?
column42:
2021-12-20 06:59;craig.newman;See notes from the 11/23/2021 InM conference call with Ted for proposed path forward.

https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=81004180
column43:
2021-12-21 10:55;craig.newman;Per discussion on the InM call on 12/21/2021 - [https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=81019424]

The pattern for HL7nnnn will be described as narrative data for the table and removed as an explicit value. Explicit values are proposed to be added for an HL7 defined table used in a data element with a C*E data type. These table IDs maybe found in actual instances of v2 messages. HL7 defined tables used with other data types (eg, IS, ID, MSG, etc) shouldn't have their tables included in the actual message.
column44:
2021-12-21 10:55;craig.newman;Per discussion on the InM call on 12/21/2021 - [https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=81019424]

The pattern for HL7nnnn will be described as narrative data for the table and removed as an explicit value. Explicit values are proposed to be added for an HL7 defined table used in a data element with a C*E data type. These table IDs maybe found in actual instances of v2 messages. HL7 defined tables used with other data types (eg, IS, ID, MSG, etc) shouldn't have their tables included in the actual message.
column45: 2021-12-21 01:51;tedhl7geek;This is good - but...how do we explain or work around the issue that tight validation servers will kick an error when they encounter a code system identifier (third component of a v2 coded data element triplet) that hs something in it like "HL70548"?    These servers load in the values from the machine-readable THO content now.
column46: 2021-12-27 06:51;craig.newman;Our major concern was that by adding several hundred HL7* codes to the table that we'd make the table much more difficult to use as there will be a lot of important value which will appear after the HL7* codes and require a lot of scrolling by users. Our goal was to keep the number of code manageable but focus on the ones that we think are the most common. If the THO teams has suggestions or requirements, we're happy to try and meet the specs you lay out. InM and the v2MG aren't the vocab experts. Perhaps we should plan on discussing at WGM?
column47:
2022-01-21 09:25;jsnell;From Vocab hosting Conformance and InM on 1/21/2022:

DECISION: Motion:

Ted motions that the concept codes defined by pattern in tables 0203 and 0396 and any other V2 code systems containing pattern-based concept codes be corrected by:
 * Identify all of the pattern-based codes in V2 code systems, then determine which will be enumerated directly in the existing code system and which will not be so enumerated - Ted will lead
 * For those that should not be enumerated directly within the existing code system, those will be enumerated in a new code system(s) using good vocabulary practices
 * All pattern-based concept codes should be made inactive and appropriately documented in the comments and notes reasons for inactivating the pattern-based concept codes
 * Modify or create the appropriate value sets that inform the table content that must include the pattern-based and now enumerated codes and adjust the links to the table code linkage accordingly in the V2 Tables code system

TK motion/ NR second: Motion carries 12-0-0

As a separate action:
 * Create a Jira ticket to track the outstanding item for current enumerated lists that are pattern-based (e.g., ICD procedures, etc. for different countries to be discussed in the future)

column41: 2020-06-05 12:34;craig.newman;I'm looking at various code systems and I'm not seeing the Steward property (although I do see "Committee" on some of them which may be similar). Where do I find "Steward" so that I can convince myself that it's not just v2 specific (not that I'm really questioning it, but just trying to go through the process)?
column42:
2020-06-05 01:00;jsnell;The properties are all in the UTG concept property Code System. There are two fields in the proposal that should help you locate it:
 # Change Objects: this links to an EXISTING object and shows the object as it currently exists 
 # Published Example: this links the the UTG Home Page for my branch. It is not automated enough just yet to direct you to the resource as we are still designing it (simply because we need to address the case where multiple objects are edited in one branch). The Change Objects field is actually quite helpful because it will give you the object name and type, so once you click on the Published example link you know to click on the Code System tab and search for UTG Concept Properties (Note that the Title does differ from the file name so it still has some quirks - we have created [https://confluence.hl7.org/display/VOC/Cross+Reference+of+Resource+Elements+and+Filenames] to help locate objects based on Name, Title, or URL).

I will note in our Pilot feedback that it wasn't clear and obvious how to find the object in my branch so that we can ensure to make it easier in the future. Thanks as always for the feedback and for participating in the Pilot. :)
column43: 2020-06-08 05:58;craig.newman;[~jsnell], what I was looking for was not the change you made but how the actual property of Steward is used. When I open up any given code system should I see an attribute for "Steward". As a reviewer, I wanted to make sure Steward isn't just used for v2 but is used elsewhere (again, not that I don't trust you, but just trying to think the whole process through). But I can't find any Code System that seems to use it. I'm just wondering if I"m missing it somewhere. Thanks.
column44: 2020-06-08 06:27;tedhl7geek;this is subtle, and thank you Craig for pointing out a need in our documentation and process.    This 'steward' property is on a CONCEPT, not a code system or value set.   It is primarily used in the concept representing v2 tables, but it appeared it may be appropriate for some other special cases, such as hierarchies of concept in ActCode specifically for Claims/Reimbursement, and the notion is to use this to indicate that the tree of codes are steward by FM (as an example).  It will be used very sparingly outside of the v2 tables IMHO.

2020-07-09 10:33;jsnell;[~tedhl7geek], did you run a script to pull out the cross reference information?

Ideally we do something programmatic that updates with each build (and likely put the information on the build pages and not Confluence).
column49: 2020-08-04 01:13;rhausam;[~tedhl7geek]  You said "it appeared it may be appropriate for some other special cases, such as hierarchies of concept in ActCode specifically for Claims/Reimbursement, and the notion is to use this to indicate that the tree of codes are steward by FM (as an example)".  So, to be clear, I think you mean that this will be used to identify a particular *subhierarchy* that exists within a single code system?  And, if so, then this property is then applied to *each* of the individual concepts that are included in that particular subhierarchy?

2022-06-14 10:18;mkmcdaniel;6/14/2022 FMWG Notes. 

Question for V2MG:  Does the CWE have to have a qualifier? If so, this may not be correct.

1) The 0560 - Coded Content. Need to remove the values that are being displayed.
2) remove the table reference from  Chapter 16 PSL-12 Product/Service Quantity
3) Chapter 16, 16.4.6.8 ADJ-6 Adjustment Quantity
a) remove the table value displayed in the lsit
b) Remove the paragraph:
X12 REF: table 673 Quantity Qualifier. New values from X12 673 can be added as required. Refer to User-defined Table 0560 - Quantity Units in Chapter 2C, Code Tables, for suggested values. 

[~craig.newman], Any suggestions for how we go forward?
THX....
column39:
2022-08-12 07:54;craig.newman;[~mkmcdaniel] 

v2MG is fine with removing the example values from table 560 is that is what FM wants

For a data type like CQ where the CWE is a Component, the binding to the table of coded values must be in the field, and not in the data type because the binding may be different for different fields using CQ. So for PSL-12 and ADJ-6, it is appropriate to keep the table 560 list in the segment definition. If you think that these two fields should be using different units of measure, then there should be multiple tables (but given that for at least 560, there are no suggested having separate tables may not provide any additional value over just using 560 for both fields)
column40: 2022-08-22 11:57;FrankOemig;Are we then reduce table 0560 to concept domain only!?
column41:
2022-08-22 01:00;mfaughn;That would make sense. 

Note that removing the suggested values also requires editing the segment field definitions that reference table 560's suggested values.
